V • I am directed to Bay that the following additions should be made to the first edition of the Permanent Supple ment to the Sixth edition of the Indian Word Code 1924t- PERMAHBHT SUPPLBMBHT i On pa^e 59 insert ZYYGO Reserve Bank(of India) On p age 65, insert ZYYGO Reserve Bank (of India) The above group ZYYGO should be brought into use with immediate effecte The Indian holders concerned of the Indian Word Code should be informed accordingly forthwith*

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 15/23 II List of Holders of I.W.C. etc. and rules relating thereto.'

physicalDescription.extent: File papers are arranged chronologically, followed by file notes (folio 9).

There is one incomplete foliation sequence and one complete foliation sequence. The complete foliation sequence is circled in pencil, in the top right corner of each folio. It begins on the first item of correspondence, on number 1, and runs through to 10, ending on the inside of the back cover of the file.

mods.abstract: The file contains lists of amendments and additions to be made to the ‘First Edition of the Permanent Supplement to the Sixth edition of the Indian Word Code 1924’ in 1936. These updates were circulated to the Political Agent, Bahrain and others by the Government of India, Director-General of Posts and Telegraphs. A Bahrain Agency clerk would then make the necessary alterations to the Bahrain Agency’s office copy of the Indian Word Code (IWC).Indian code words were made available to designated IWC holders for use in certain official communications. Code words could be substituted for and replace the names of Government of India post holders, departments and external organisations. Code words were also used to communicate a specific instruction, such as a particular action to be carried out by the recipient.
